intro: Holothrix triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed holothrix, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically lobed, giving it its common name. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are usually yellow or orange in color. Holothrix triloba is well adapted to arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
